<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Combinations of the above attributes that are relevant to instruction</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// decode. Although other combinations are possible, they can be reduced to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// these without affecting the ultimately decoded instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           Class name           Rank  Rationale for rank assignment</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83" lineLink="#a254172912b86aaedc5718b18fa05d6cf"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define INSTRUCTION&#95;CONTEXTS                                                   \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  ENUM&#95;ENTRY(IC, 0, &quot;says nothing about the instruction&quot;)                      \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  ENUM&#95;ENTRY(IC&#95;64BIT, 1,                                                      \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">             &quot;says the instruction applies in 64-bit mode but no more&quot;)        \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  ENUM&#95;ENTRY(IC&#95;OPSIZE, 3,                                                     \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">             &quot;requires an OPSIZE prefix, so operands change width&quot;)            \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  ENUM&#95;ENTRY(IC&#95;ADSIZE, 3,                                                     \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">             &quot;requires an ADSIZE prefix, so operands change width&quot;)            \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  ENUM&#95;ENTRY(IC&#95;OPSIZE&#95;ADSIZE, 4, &quot;requires ADSIZE and OPSIZE prefixes&quot;)       \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  ENUM&#95;ENTRY(IC&#95;XD, 2,                                                         \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">             &quot;may say something about the opcode but not the operands&quot;)        \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  ENUM&#95;ENTRY(IC&#95;XS, 2,                                                         \\</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86disassembler/#aaab12f79117070dc035099f1daed2b8ea632479f320c04b5fc5d78d25d507b434"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86disassembler/#aaab12f79117070dc035099f1daed2b8ea632479f320c04b5fc5d78d25d507b434">MAP7</a> = 11</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="385"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The following structs are used for the hierarchical decode table.  After</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="388"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// determining the instruction&#39;s class (i.e., which IC&#95;&#42; constant applies to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it), the decoder reads the opcode.  Some instructions require specific</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// values of the ModR/M byte, so the ModR/M byte indexes into the final table.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="391"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="392"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If a ModR/M byte is not required, &quot;required&quot; is left unset, and the values</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="393"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for each instructionID are identical.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86disassembler/#a48739e7e428e4607c5699d7417498956"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typedef</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> uint16&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86disassembler/#a48739e7e428e4607c5699d7417498956">InstrUID</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ModRMDecisionType - describes the type of ModR/M decision, allowing the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// consumer to determine the number of entries in it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// MODRM&#95;ONEENTRY - No matter what the value of the ModR/M byte is, the decoded</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                  instruction is the same.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// MODRM&#95;SPLITRM  - If the ModR/M byte is between 0 and 0xbf, the opcode</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                  corresponds to one instruction; otherwise, it corresponds to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                  a different instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// MODRM&#95;SPLITMISC- If the ModR/M byte is between 0 and 0xbf, ModR/M byte</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                  divided by 8 is used to select instruction; otherwise, each</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                  value of the ModR/M byte could correspond to a different</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                  instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// MODRM&#95;SPLITREG - ModR/M byte divided by 8 is used to select instruction. This</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                  corresponds to instructions that use reg field as opcode</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// MODRM&#95;FULL     - Potentially, each value of the ModR/M byte could correspond</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                  to a different instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412" lineLink="#a5406c5ad64936fc7e044d3dbbeeea377"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define MODRMTYPES                                                             \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  ENUM&#95;ENTRY(MODRM&#95;ONEENTRY)                                                   \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  ENUM&#95;ENTRY(MODRM&#95;SPLITRM)                                                    \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  ENUM&#95;ENTRY(MODRM&#95;SPLITMISC)                                                  \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  ENUM&#95;ENTRY(MODRM&#95;SPLITREG)                                                   \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="417"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  ENUM&#95;ENTRY(MODRM&#95;FULL)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="418"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define ENUM&#95;ENTRY(n) n,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86disassembler/#ac063173220632f668a30cc362d88c849af309372802ea84a6b162983f4d5dab66"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86disassembler/#ac063173220632f668a30cc362d88c849">ModRMDecisionType</a> &#123; <a href="#a5406c5ad64936fc7e044d3dbbeeea377">MODRMTYPES</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86disassembler/#ac063173220632f668a30cc362d88c849af309372802ea84a6b162983f4d5dab66">MODRM&#95;max</a> &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
